intro: Phoradendron villosum, commonly known as the silky mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on various host trees, primarily in the Americas. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it its common name. The plant lacks true roots and absorbs water and nutrients through its stems, which are specialized for attachment to host trees. Its small, white or yellowish flowers are followed by bright red berries that are an important food source for birds. Due to its parasitic nature, it can have significant ecological impacts on its host species.
